melee.name: Melee
melee.description: This creature excels at close combat and has limited or no ranged combat capabilities.

ranged.name: Ranged
ranged.description: This creature attacks from afar and has limited or no melee combat capabilities.

ambusher.name: Ambusher
ambusher.description: This creature ideally starts combat from a hidden position and waits for the optimal moment to attack.

airborne.name: Airborne
airborne.description: This creature has a flying speed and can continuously stay at a distance.

charge.name: Charge
charge.description: This creature seeks close combat from the get-go and will continue to do so.

predator.name: Predator
predator.description: This creature stalks its prey and will withdraw from combat to attack again later.

pack.name: Pack
pack.description: This creature is best utilized as part of a larger group of similar creatures.

regeneration.name: Regeneration
regeneration.description: This creature has abilities allowing it to regenerate hit points during combat.

mobile.name: Mobile
mobile.description: This creature boasts superior speed and mobility, allowing it to quickly reposition itself or give chase to enemies.

tactical.name: Tactical
tactical.description: This creature’s abilities facilitate powerful synergies, increasing its effectiveness.

shock.name: Shock
shock.description: This creature is most effective during the first turns of combat.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
spellcasting.description: This creature is capable of casting spells.

demanding.name: Demanding
demanding.description: Fighting this monster requires lots of saving throws.

simple.name: Simple
simple.description: This creature excels at close combat and has limited or no ranged combat capabilities.

lethal.name: Lethal
lethal.description: This creature is more than capable of actually killing a player character.

aoe.name: AoE
aoe.description: This creature heavily utilizes >Area Of Effect< damage.

interactive.name: Interactive
interactive.description: This creature utilizes a combination of abilities, actions, bonus actions and reactions.

boss.name: Boss
boss.description: This creature boasts impressive stats and abilities, requiring several turns of intense combat that acts as a dramatic climax.

bodyguard.name: Bodyguard
bodyguard.description: This creature aims to protect another creature, rarely leaving its side and acting in the interest of keeping danger from it.

debuff.name: Debuff
debuff.description: This creature weakens or hinders its enemies.

support.name: Support
support.description: This creature strengthens its allies, increasing their effectiveness, but poses less of a challenge on its own.

tank.name: Tank
tank.description: This creature is extremely resilient, boasting a combination of a high hit point count, resistances or immunities.

minion.name: Minion
minion.description: This creature is relatively harmless on its own and is best used as a meat shield.

damage.name: Damage
damage.description: This creature is best utilized as a reliable source of damage.

mount.name: Mount
mount.description: This creature can serve as a mount for either a player or an enemy.

ally.name: Ally
ally.description: This creature can act as an ally to a group of players.

pressure.name: Pressure
pressure.description: This creature provides unique challenges able to overwhelm its enemies.

hunter.name: Hunter
hunter.description: This creature concentrates its attention on single targets.

leader.name: Leader
leader.description: This creature is best utilized as the leader of a group of enemies, acting as a lynchpin for the encounter.

duelist.name: Duelist
duelist.description: This creature's set of abilities allows for an exciting back and forth with a single opponent.

gimmick.name: Gimmick
gimmick.description: This creature possesses one or more gimmicks, specific and unique mechanics, that an encounter with this creature will revolve around.

swallow.name: Swallow
swallow.description: This creature can and will swallow players, splitting parties and possibly dealing damage over time.

legendary.name: Legendary
legendary.description: This creature poses a formidable and complex challenge, makes use of legendary actions and requires special attention regarding the conception and execution of an encounter with it.

001_primal_vampire_spawn.description: Sometimes Vampires impart the dubious gift of spawndom upon the wrong soul, stirring primordial horrors from their sleep. These vampire spawns regress to a primal state, detached from the rules that even compel their creators, driven only by their lust for terror and agony.  Primal Spawns are beyond their unwilling creators' control and they in turn feel disdain for their more â€˜evolvedâ€™ kin. Despite not having a weakness to sunlight, they prefer the shadows, as the darkness supports their preferred hunting style. And if the right opportunity arises, a Primal Vampire Spawn will not hesitate to hunt during broad daylight to indulge in the screams of horrified onlookers.
001_primal_vampire_spawn.name: Primal Vampire Spawn

002_gluttony.description: This creature is the embodiment of self indulgence, the nature-given love and need for sustenance perverted and twisted into a bloated creature of repulsive proportions. Gluttony poisons mind and body in equal measure and hungers endlessly, existing for the singular purpose to make everything in existence one with itself.
002_gluttony.name: Gluttony

003_inquisitorial_penitent.description: Inquisitorial Penitents are former witches, persecuted and excruciatingly converted by those they now serve as living weapons. Their connection to the arcane has been perverted, the flow of magic reversed, as they now syphon arcane energies from others with their mere presence. They stalk the lands in packs, travel as independent operatives or are part of an inquisitorial retinue, acting as both bodyguards and executioners. The most dangerous penitents, however, are those who underwent the purifications voluntarily, eager to shed the taint of witchcraft. They are the most unforgiving and zealous of their kind, hunting their tainted kin without mercy or remorse.
003_inquisitorial_penitent.name: Inquisitorial Penitent

005_assassin_1.description: If one seeks to end a life, one does not necessarily have to get their hands dirty. There are professionals trained in the art of killing, who are eager to be of service - either to earn some coin, further a dark agenda or for personal pleasure. The play of murder has thousands of scripts and props, but a knife in the dark remains an all time classic.
005_assassin_1.name: Assassin

006_shield_guardian_1.description: Exposure to extreme instances of magnetism might cause an as of yet unexplained transformation within Shield Guardians.The docile automatons undergo a rapid evolution, triggering both a physical transformation and a severe change in behaviour. A Polarized Shield Guardian is no longer bound to its master, resisting any attempt of external control with violent means. Their physique adapts to support a construct now geared towards offensive conflict resolution, rather than silent endurance. These creatures are exceedingly rare and, if able to break their shackles for good, wander the lands guided by their mysterious connection to both magical and magnetic forces.
006_shield_guardian_1.name: Polarized Shield Guardian

006_shield_guardian_2.description: Exposure to extreme instances of magnetism might cause an as of yet unexplained transformation within Shield Guardians.The docile automatons undergo a rapid evolution, triggering both a physical transformation and a severe change in behaviour. A Polarized Shield Guardian is no longer bound to its master, resisting any attempt of external control with violent means. Their physique adapts to support a construct now geared towards offensive conflict resolution, rather than silent endurance. These creatures are exceedingly rare and, if able to break their shackles for good, wander the lands guided by their mysterious connection to both magical and magnetic forces.
006_shield_guardian_2.name: Polarized Shield Guardian

007_umber_spinner.description: Umber Hulks spend their youthful days terrorising the Underdark or similar subterranean spaces. In this harsh environment, few survive long enough to see their powerful frame diminish with age, shedding the recognizable heavy chitinous plating and finally sprouting wings and a wicked stinger. On buzzing wings the now pubescent Umber Spinners set out, seeking weakened or isolated humanoids in their mission to preserve the dominion of their kind...
007_umber_spinner.name: Umber Spinner

008_gluttonys_aspect.description: Dull-looking, dimwitted and bloated creatures, filled to the brim with noxious gas and disgusting thoughts. They nest within the fleshy crevasses of Gluttony's lumpy body and swarm out on its command, eager to gather offerings to gain their master's favour.
008_gluttonys_aspect.name: Gluttony's Aspect

009_skeleton_henchman_1.description: If you are interested in exercising cross-regional influence and could not care less about your image,  Skeleton Henchmen are the ideal lynchpin for your entourage. They are loyal, cheap and, if you know your way around the local cemetery, rather easy to aquire. The basic Skeleton Henchman is a great foundation to expand upon, as they are highly customizable and require minimal upkeep and maintenance. Guard duty, law enforcement or warfare, Skeleton Henchmen provide satisfactory service in diverse work environments.
009_skeleton_henchman_1.name: Skeleton Henchman

010_horse_1.description: Horses are half a ton worth of muscle crammed into an elegant and timeless frame. They are fast, they are not particularly intelligent and they are an essential component of the fantasy genre. In the context of adventuring, Horses are mainly used for travel and battle, although they may as well become trusted and loved companions to the players. This reimagination of the classic Horse embodies a sturdy and valiant creature able to support it's party on arduous voyages as well as dire combat scenarios.
010_horse_1.name: Horse

011_trained_fighter_1.description: War veterans, gang members with military experience or nobles who spent a fair share of their youth under the watchful eyes of combat instructors - the Trained Fighter represents all of them and more. They are trained in the art of melee, have seen various combat scenarios and lived to tell the tale. While a rabble of peasants or a gang of highwaymen can be disposed of rather quickly and with little effort, an organized troop of Trained Fighters makes for a varitable fighting force, leading to a complex and tactical encounter for a low or even mid-level party.
011_trained_fighter_1.name: Trained Fighter

012_cipactli.description: Cipactli are the alleged offspring of a reptilian river god feared for his boundless rage. They roam mangrove forests and tropical river banks in packs, behaving very territorial and highly aggressive towards any kind of encroachment. Their social behaviour is suprisingly complex, with them displaying their martial skills through ritualized combat among each other. However, if isolated from its pack, a Cipactli can form an equally strong bond with any creature able to gain the Cipactli's respect by demonstrating superior prowess. Indigenous tribes have been observed utilizing bonded Cipactli as status symbols, as well as beasts of burden or instruments of war. Tribal legends tell of champions riding into battle mounted on a rampaging Cipactli, battering aside enemies and jungle trees alike in a display of rage worthy of their eponymous genitor.
012_cipactli.name: Cipactli

013_harpyia.description: Not many a  creature is as unjustly feared and detested as the Harpyia. Decried as carriers of bad omen, death and evil magic, they have been hunted to near extinction. The remaining Harpyies prefer to nest on storm-wreathed cliffsides and within coastal ravines, seeking safety in isolation. Legend has them born from wind and water, which might explain their affinity to the sea. Colonies, or *parliaments*, of Harpyies can be often found nesting atop the salt-encrusted masts and rigging of beached shipwrecks. This behaviour unfortunately further feeds the hate and fear towards them, as they stand accused of gloating over the misfortune of others, when in reality Harpyies are inclined to protect shipwrecked sailors from actual malicious creatures like the alluring Sirens.
013_harpyia.name: Harpyia

014_dragon.description: The Dragon might be the ultimate mythical creature. Almost every human culture has a being with the shared traits of a snake-like body, mighty wings, supernatural cunning and indomitable might. In some myths and folktales they are benevolent and wise, in most they are cruel and despotic. Our dragon makes no attempt at being an ambivalent creature, skirting the border of good and evil or trying to paint the picture of a complex and often misunderstood creature. This dragon is a scaled tyrant, a megalomaniacal lizard corrupted by the arcane energies flowing through its veins. It is avaricious, gluttonous, wrathful and treacherous - the worst traits humanity can offer, but enabled by inhabiting a body of a living and breathing natural disaster.
014_dragon.name: Dragon

015_werewolf_1.description: The Wulfen Curse is an affliction of the soul. Some humanoids already carry the seed of beasthood with them, nurturing a dark hunger for violence and bloodshed. If they give in to this hunger, the dread curse takes hold, shaping the body in accordance to the soul. Over time the Wulfen comes to detest its humanoid body, the metaphysical affliction of the soul mirrored in the physical realm. They are, however, forever trapped between worlds, for they are neither wolf nor man, but a chimeric soul burdened with an appetite for both the chase and the catch.
015_werewolf_1.name: Werewolf

015_werewolf_2.description: The Wulfen Curse is an affliction of the soul. Some humanoids already carry the seed of beasthood with them, nurturing a dark hunger for violence and bloodshed. 015_werewolf_2.name: Werewolf

015_werewolf_3.name: Werewolf

016_wolf_1.description: Those afflicted by the Curse of the Wulfen slowly lose themselves to the bestial urges festering within their soul. After each hunt it gets harder to take on human form and even the horrid shape of the man-wolf becomes difficult to maintain. Soon the Wolfkin have all but forgotten what it means to be human and gather around a strong Wulfen to lead them on their eternal hunt. Or just a normal Wolf.
016_wolf_1.name: Wolf

016_wolf_2.description: Those afflicted by the Curse of the Wulfen slowly lose themselves to the bestial urges festering within their soul. After each hunt it gets harder to take on human form and even the horrid shape of the man-wolf becomes difficult to maintain. Soon the Wolfkin have all but forgotten what it means to be human and gather around a strong Wulfen to lead them on their eternal hunt. Or just a normal Wolf.
016_wolf_2.name: Wolf

016_wolf_3.description: Those afflicted by the Curse of the Wulfen slowly lose themselves to the bestial urges festering within their soul. After each hunt it gets harder to take on human form and even the horrid shape of the man-wolf becomes difficult to maintain. Soon the Wolfkin have all but forgotten what it means to be human and fully dedicate themselves to the hunt. Bigger, stronger and blessed with remaining spark of malicious intellect, Wolfkin soon find themselves in charge of a pack of regular wolves, often answering the call of other hunting Wulfen, eager to redden their snout in the ensuing bloodbath. Or just a normal Wolf.
016_wolf_3.name: Wolfkin

016_wolf_4.description: For all their might, wolf packs live dangerous lifes on a knife’s edge. Bad weather, lack of food or the confrontation with a superior opponent can spell certain death for a whole pack. And even those who narrowly escape death may succumb to the hardships of the wilderness. But some adapt to a life of solitude. Their constant fight for survival shapes them to be more ferocious in combat and forces them to rely on their keen senses even more. They develop a sharper instinct for survival and become more cunning than their pack-hunting kin, often stalking their chosen prey for days before deciding on the ideal moment to strike.
016_wolf_4.name: Lone Wolf

017_dwarven_king.description: Dwarven Kings do not rule by birthright alone, but command respect earned by dilligence, grit and merit. Dwarves are a proud and stubborn folk and while they appreciate the rigid structures of monarchy, they need a reason for why a specific individual should hold the power to rule the grand cave cities, vast mountain halls and stalwart hill fortresses of dwarvenkind. However, if an aspirant to the throne manages to endure the ordeals and rites necessary to claim the title of king, their subjects serve them with unwavering loyalty. Each Dwarven King is a statesman, general and master craftsman with a body of granite, a soul of iron and a heart of gold.
017_dwarven_king.name: Dwarven King

018_giant_spider_1.description: Based on your disposition towards spiders in general, a confrontation with Megaarachnids can range from unpleasant to traumatising. They are vicious predators who are dangerous when you see them, as they can unexpectedly cross surprising distances with mighty leaps, but infinitively more dangerous if you don't, as they excel at lurking in the shadows while waiting in their web, eager to strike as their prey becomes more and more entangled. Megaarachnids usually hunt alone or in small packs to take down bigger prey, but are also known to band together in vast colonies, occupying claustrophobic burrows or abandoned structures, creating a web-covered and egg-filled nightmare realm littered with the dried out husks of their victims.
018_giant_spider_1.name: Weblurker Arachnid

018_giant_spider_6.description: Based on your disposition towards spiders in general, a confrontation with Megaarachnids can range from unpleasant to traumatising. They are vicious predators who are dangerous when you see them, as they can unexpectedly cross surprising distances with mighty leaps, but infinitively more dangerous if you don't, as they excel at lurking in the shadows while waiting in their web, eager to strike as their prey becomes more and more entangled. Megaarachnids usually hunt alone or in small packs to take down bigger prey, but are also known to band together in vast colonies, occupying claustrophobic burrows or abandoned structures, creating a web-covered and egg-filled nightmare realm littered with the dried out husks of their victims.

019_reef_keeper.description: Reef Keepers manifest around hydrothermal vents and venture the sea bed in search of untouched subnautic ecosystems like lush coral reefs or kelp forests, where they guard the native lifeforms against invasive species or destructive unnatural forces. Their true form is hard to discern, as they are overgrown with a thick crust of mineral-rich sediment. This crust acts both as natural armor, as well as a rich source of nutrients for nearby flora and fauna. Reef Keepers are usually docile, but if they consider their chosen protectorate endangered they make use of a vast arsenal of exotic defensive capabilities
019_reef_keeper.name: Reef Keeper

020_grimgheist.description: Grimgheists are soul-constructs fashioned from murderous and vengeful souls by particularly ruthless practicers of dark and forbidden arts. Driven by an innate thirst for murder and furtherly incited by their creators, the Grimgheist are tasked to either haunt a specific target or to just wreak havoc among the enemies of its master. As they can effortlessly travel between the profane and the ethereal world, they make for efficient assassins, being able to materialize infront of their hapless target and unleash horrible acts of violence upon it, fueled by pure hatred for the living.
020_grimgheist.name: Grimgheist

021_ghoul_wretchling.description: The scratching and scrawling noises of Ghoul Wretchlings in the walls and under the floor boards herald an incoming Ghoul Invasion. In the following nights people disappear from the streets or the safety of their homes, overwhelmed and paralyzed by  swarms of the scrawny Ghoul Wretchlings, before being dragged to the underground lairs as nourishment for the advancing main force of Ghoulish invaders.
021_ghoul_wretchling.name: Ghoul Wretchling

022_orc_shaman.description: Shamans are the spiritual leaders of an orc warhost. They maintain the moral of the troops by conducting bonding rituals and are generally tasked with a wide array of ceremonial duties. Even though they are feared and respected, Shamans often are outsiders, as their reclusive nature and connection to the spiritual world warps them into capricious eccentrics. Most Shamans are not bound to any host, as their true loyalty lies with the shamanistic covens they belong to, often only supporting a host chief when their reign of terror furthers the Shamans own, often concealed, agenda. In combat, Shamans are fearsome opponents who may call upon forces of nature to bring their enemies to their knees. They are able to call upon aid from beyond the grave and inspire the troops surrounding them to fight even harder, as they feel their ancestor's gaze upon them.
022_orc_shaman.name: Orc Shaman

023_orc_warchief.description: The Warchief is the single greatest authority within the ranks of a war host - an inspiring, or at least intimidating, leader, a successful commander and a powerful warrior. If they set foot onto a battlefield, their troops throw themselves every more recklessly at the enemy ranks, seeking the approval of their sovereign. Every trace of weakness must purged and every defeat could spell doom for an aspiring conqueror. This realisation often leaves War Chiefs paranoid and choleric, while their constant need to prove their might and tactical acumen drives them to ever greater bloodshed and destruction.
023_orc_warchief.name: Orc Warchief

024_kentauros.description: Where the azure sky and the lush green of viridian grasslands meet, the Kentauroi reign without equal. They are the undisputed lords of vast plains, steppes, taigas or savannahs. Being nomadic and reclusive, most live in tribal herd-clans, eternally roaming the sacred lands of their forebearers. But there are tales from the eastern fringes, describing hordes of Kentauroi coming together under the banners of a Great Khan, blocking out the skies with thousands of arrows and grinding villages, armies and fortress gates into the dust below their hooves.
024_kentauros.name: Kentauros

025_trained_archer_1.description: Ranger, hunters or city guards standing watch on battlements or rooftops - the Trained Archer is a stand-in for every man and woman well versed in the art of the bow. They are capable sharpshooters and can be relied upon in the heat of battle, an ambush or even an assassination. With the weaker members of a party threatened with a barrage of arrows, an organized unit of Trained Archers makes for a flexible and deadly force, leading to a complex and tactical encounter for a low or even mid-level party.
025_trained_archer_1.name: Trained Archer

025_trained_archer_2.description: Ranger, hunters or city guards standing watch on battlements or rooftops - the Trained Archer is a stand-in for every man and woman well versed in the art of the bow. 026_vampire_spawn_1.description: Everlasting mist floods the land of Barovia, the cursed realm of Strahd von Zahrovich. Barovia teems with dreadful creatures, most of which are hellbent on making the player's stay in their realm a harrowing one. For Spooktober 2021 we decided to give the iconic Vampire Spawns roaming the crypts and castles of Curse of Strahd a unique spin! The Barovian Vampire spawn is closely bonded to Strahd, who is the land himself, as we all know! This is reflected by increased mental stats and a strange symbiotic relationship with the mist that wreathes it's masters domain, granting a formidable foe even more power and making for a creature able to haunt even veteran players' nightmares!
026_vampire_spawn_1.name: Vampire Spawn

027_revenant_knight_1.description: The once great Knights of the Order are tragic figures, rust-flaked shades of their former selves, filled only with poisobous thoughts of vengeance and seething hatred. Our Revenant Knight is a tribute to the fallen Order of the Silver Dragon and leans more heaviliy into the tragic nobility of an undead order of Dragon-sworn Knights, with the icy essence of Argynvost still clinging to their ruined armour, in a desperate attempt to shield them from harm even in death. The lingering soul of the Silver Dragon still permeates his brothers in arms, empowering them in dynamic and unique ways.
027_revenant_knight_1.name: Revenant Knight

028_unchained_armor.description: The second-to-last entry of our spooky tribute to our favourite vampire-centric D&D 5e module is here! The rattlinf of chains and metallic cling-clang noises coming from the basement where no illusion, as the big bads own suit of armor has come alive to terrorize nosey parties disturbing the slumber of its master. With lightning surging through the unholy metal and the aforementioned chains eagerly dangling from its black-iron frame, our interpretation if the animated armor is even more vicious than the orignal!
028_unchained_armor.name: Unchained Armor

029_infernal_steed_1.description: This equine nightmare enjoys soaring through the nightly sky, terrorizing local villagers in their very, very flammable homes and (sometimes literally) booting uppity adventurers from its masters castle.
029_infernal_steed_1.name: Infernal Steed

029_infernal_steed_2.description: This equine nightmare enjoys soaring through the nightly sky, terrorizing local villagers in their very, very flammable homes and (sometimes literally) booting uppity adventurers from its masters castle.

030_commoner_1_m_worker.description: Commoners are salt of the earth people inhabiting the various hamlets, villages, hovels and huts strewn around any country, kingdom or frontier. They can be barbers, bakers, bar- or beekeepers, hard working and tax paying folks that may welcome adventurers with open arms into the midst of their society or keep a keen eye on any outsider encroaching on their territory, threatening to make the rapidly shortening remainder of their lives more interesting.
030_commoner_1_m_worker.name: Commoner Male Worker

031_swarm_of_vampire_bats.description: Except as a carrier of disease, a single bat does not usually pose much of a challenge for both fledgling and seasoned adventurers. But add a few hundred or even thousand bats, and you're suddenly confronted with a shrieking inferno of razor claws and pointy teeth, able to gnaw any humanoid the meat from its bones by sheer mass of bodies. Now, regular swarms of bats normally don't show signs of aggression towards beings larger than their insect prey. But in a world steeped in dark magic and beset by evil forces, bats can become dangerous creatures, revelling in a vampiric nature normally only shown by a few select subspecies of bats. These bloodthirsty swarms of bats darken the moonlight sky with ominous intent and are said to only leave drained husks in their wake...
031_swarm_of_vampire_bats.name: Swarm of Vampire Bats

032_night_hag_1.description: Night Hags (sometimes literally) just scream ''Dungeons and Dragons'' to us, so we are happy to just bang out this classic a monster once in a while! Night hags are vile creatures, once proud denizens of the fae wild who's cruel inclinations got them banished to the Grey Wastes, an ever-gloomy hellscape out in the Far Realms. Not that it matters, for they are able to plane shift to freely spread their very own flavour of chaos, obsession and corruption by poisoning creatures dreams, driving them mad and eventually collecting their souls. Of course, we made some adjustments to the original creature, giving her two additional nightmarish abilities!
032_night_hag_1.name: Night Hag

033_yeti.description: Yetis are a chimeric breed, carrying an accumulation of odd traits from their ancestors. Who exactly those ancestors were is unclear, but the Yeti's immunity to even magical cold that far exceeds any natural resistances, as well as their regenerative healing abilites seem to imply a shared heritage based upon both the blood of Frost Giants as well as Trolls. How this unholy alliance came to pass remains mercifully unknown, but it is terrifying nonetheless.
033_yeti.name: Yeti

034_war_troll.description: Despite Trolls not being particularly sociable, someone just went ahead and recruited some into his merry band of raiders. The prospect of loot and food might have been enough, but no honest Troll would ever pass up the chance to deal out some unchecked violence as well. Thanks to that brave and creative individual more and more bandit leaders, orc war chiefs or mercenary captains managed to coax one of the hulking brutes into joining their venture. These War-Trolls are a tad more intelligent than their truly feral kin and, if drilled correctly, will even follow basic orders. A well trained and experienced War-Troll is truly dangerous, as it knows to efficiently apply its devastating strength to crush its enemies with ease.
034_war_troll.name: Wartroll

035_roc.description: To describe Rocs as 'gigantic birds of prey' is accurate but vastly understates the horror of a creature able to carry off a fully grown elephant in its talons. They are both profane and mythical in nature, dominating their realm due to their sheer size alone, without any magical or primordial powers coursing through them. They are able to adapt to nearly any environment, causing regional differences in their appearance, as evidenced by sightings of vividly coloured tropical Rocs, as well as arctic variants with frost-wreathed pinions, preying on Yetis and Mammoths.
035_roc.name: Roc

036_winter_empress_1.description: The Winter Empress is a fey creature, the regent of a frost-wreathed realm of eternal ice. She is an ambitious monarch and often has her court venture out into the realm of man to bring unnatural winter in their wake. Although some claim to have bested or even slain her, tales of her defeat are often followed by even more frigid devastation at the hands of the vengeful queen of ice. With the utterly devoted Knights of Winter sworn to her service, she is considered one of the most enigmatic, yet powerful of the fair lords and ladies.
036_winter_empress_1.name: Winter Empress

036_winter_empress_2.description: The Winter Empress is a fey creature, the regent of a frost-wreathed realm of eternal ice. She is an ambitious monarch and often has her court venture out into the realm of man to bring unnatural winter in their wake. Although some claim to have bested or even slain her, tales of her defeat are often followed by even more frigid devastation at the hands of the vengeful queen of ice. With the utterly devoted Knights of Winter sworn to her service, she is considered one of the most enigmatic, yet powerful of the fair lords and ladies.
036_winter_empress_2.name: Winter Empress Armored

037_royal_griffon.description: Since ages past, the Griffon has been a symbol of just and virtuos regency, earning their species the prefix 'royal'. Because of this symbolism, Royal Griffons are coveted mounts and familiars for any ambitious sovereign. Taming a feral Griffon is a dangerous and arduous undertaking, therefore most trained Griffons originate from Heralds Aerie, a mountain bastion held by an Order of Knights dedicated to forging a bond between a Griffon and its rider.
037_royal_griffon.name: Royal Griffon

038_arcane_incursor.description: Arcane Incursors resemble interplanar trapdoor spiders, as they burrow into the veil between worlds where they are lying wait, only to burst forth from their lair if magic weakens the border between planes. Once the incursion is completed, they begin their hunt for raw arcane energy, usually starting with the unlucky caster of the spell that lured the Incursor into their world. Arcane Incursors usually hunt alone, but a sufficiently great source of magic might draw more specimens, marking the beginning of an infestation with catastrophic prospects for the local mage population.
038_arcane_incursor.name: Arcane Incursor

039_elder_curseroot.description: There are many different Curseroots. Some are small, creeping vines and lumps of moss insidious in nature, some are looming and outright violent, thick-rooted and towering trees, roaring with anger. They are tainted plantlife, sprouted from evil seeds spread by a cursed tree. If even a single Cursewood is found, whole forests must be put to the torch, as the corruption spreads quickly and sometimes even a lone acorn may grow into an unfathomable evil.
039_elder_curseroot.name: Elder Curseroot

040_ossian_debt_collector.description: The Debt Collectors are operatives of the Ossian Bank, tasked with tracking and retrieving especially elusive debtors. Despite their harrowing appearance, Ossian Debt Collectors are courteous and sophisticated negotiators, blessed with the endless patience of the undead and prodigious language skills. When approaching a debtor, they initially aim on settling things amicably, politely asking the transient debtor to accompany them to the Ossian Bank to stand before the Tribunal. When met with unreasonableness or hostility, the Debt Collectors begrudgingly change tactics in favour of more direct means of apprehension. It is unclear if their skeletal appearance reflects a Collector's true being or if it only appears as such to their targets, combining two of the things mortals fear most: death and tax collectors.
040_ossian_debt_collector.name: Ossian Debt Collector

041_elephant.description: Elephants are intelligent, social and awe-inspiring creatures inhabiting savannahs, jungles and deserts of countless realms. Many cultures consider them sacred, recognizing the gentle soul of a towering, but kind creature through their caring eyes. Elephants can coexist with many different folks, acting as support for the workforce or as devastating living siege weapons in warfare. Killing wild elephants however may draw the ire of its relatives and enraged elephants are able to tear down a settlement brick by brick, if so inclined.
041_elephant.name: Elephant

042_mournbride.description: Mournbrides are the tortured souls of women dying a violent death on what was promised to be the happiest day of their lifes: their wedding day. Great tragedy usually surrounds a Mournbride's ermergence, like murder at the hands of a jealous rival or the taking of ones own life after being left at the altar. Still wrapped in the tattered and blood splattered remains of their wedding gowns, Mournbrides haunt places of great significance to the departed individual, like their family home, wedding venue or secret a meeting place with their former beloved. If their would-be spouse is still alive, the Mournbride will jealously watch over them, often causing more harm than good in their twisted need to protect them.
042_mournbride.name: Mournbride

043_mind_golem.description: Mind golems are enforcer-creatures crafted by Wizard councils, a mighty body shaped from synthetic flesh imbued with a powerful vat-grown brain, designed to contain the councils Mindmeld. A Mindmeld is psychic amalgamation of the wizards intellect and arcane potential, directly channeling their might and will into their creation, allowing it to act more independently than other forms of golems. Their fused psyches birth new independent thought slaved to their will, which makes Mind golems highly intelligent and capable of stratetic planning and tactical acumen. This, paired with their enourmous strength and innate magic abilities, makes for a truly dangerous living weapon, capable of completing the most daring operations for their masters.
043_mind_golem.name: Mind Golem

044_amygdalyan.description: Amygdalyan are predators from beyond the thin veil separating reality from the infinite ocean of madness beyond. They are drawn to trauma and tragedy like moths to a flame, first appearing in the dreams of their chosen victim, before infiltrating their mind, driving their hosts to bouts of insanity and paranoia before destroying their psyche and moving on, their perverse hunger seated for the time being. If cornered, an Amygdalyan is a cunning and perfidioius foe, using it enemies' greatest fears against them and until they perish from the strain the constant terror puts on their body and mind.
044_amygdalyan.name: Amygdalyan

045_shattermaw.description: Shattermaws are colossal bad-tempered monstrosities clad in nearly impenetrable osteodermic armour, consisting of bone knobs, plates and spine-like outgrows. Despite their turtle-like appearance, they appear to be an evolutionary offshoot of semi-aquatic sharks. Their thick leathery skin mirrors the swamp-green of their habitat and their cragged shells and bone protrusions become eventually overgrown by moss, algae and lichens, making Shattermaws surprisingly difficult to notice. Their diet consists of everything unlucky enough to wander in front of its eponymous maw, supplemented by anything barely resembling actual prey - including mossy logs, mid-sized boulders or small vehicles. This leads to swamps and river banks within Shattermaw territory being lined with the wreckage of skiffs or rafts displaying their signature corrosive bite marks.
045_shattermaw.name: Shattermaw

046_garghoul.description: A variant form of the common Ghoul, its tattered wings making it capable of flight. After nightfall, GarGhouls stalk the skies. They are to locate worthwile prey, alerting their swarm upon discovery. As one, the GarGhouls descend, paralyzing their victims with their bite before carrying them off into the dark. If acting as part of a larger force of Ghouls under the command of a higher Ghoul unlifeform, GarGhouls often form the second wave of a larger invasion, using their maddening screams to disorient their terrified victims, before the main force emerges from their hidden dwellings. Swarms of GarGhouls also patrol the vast caverns of the subterran Ghoul realms, seeking out intruders and calling their pale brethren to join them in their feast.
046_garghoul.name: Garghoul

047_swifttalon_raptor.description: Lightning fast, agile and deadly - Swifttalon Raptors showcase peak evolutionary efficiency. They hunt in small packs, stalking and outmaneuvering prey much larger than themselves. When the Raptors have their prey encircled, they first attack in waves, probing their quarry's defenses and opening up gashing wounds with their crooked talons. Lastly they overwhelm with numbers, bearing down on their exhausted prey in a flood of scales, teeth and claws.
047_swifttalon_raptor.name: Swifttalon Raptor

048_stormwyvern.description: An especially powerful Blue dragon can infuse a wyvern with its arcane draconic energy, elevating it to a Stormwyvern. Stormwyverns are bestowed a semblance of their master's elemental affinity and cunning. They serve in the dragon's forces as heralds and subcommanders, their increased intelligence allowing for a rudimentary grasp on the draconic language and a crude understanding of battle tactics.
048_stormwyvern.name: Stormwyvern

049_poisonfang.description: Poison Fangs are the elite assassins of the various serpent cults infesting overgrown temple cities or infiltrating colonial societies. Promising candidates are singled out from their brood mates early on, undergoing harrowing psycho-indoctrination to increase their resistances to various poisons and toxins, hone their inherent hypnotic abilities and trigger the transformation into a even more snake-like being. Due to their unique talents they become excellent operatives, making Poison Fangs ideal tools for political assassinations, terror campaigns or insidious purges within the own ranks.
049_poisonfang.name: Poisonfang

050_amber_idol.description: Amber Idols are constructs crafted from anointed amber, fossilized resin obtained from sacred trees. While humanoid in stature and gait, their heads resemble bestial guardian spirits of old. Amber Idols are tasked with guarding hidden temples and lost sites that harbour great evil, tirelessly patrolling ancient gaols to ensure the continued confinement of the horrors sealed within.
050_amber_idol.name: Amber Idol

051_toxic_gobbler.description: Toxic as a Gobbler is a common idiom and yet it understates the danger posed by a Gobbler. Their garishly coloured, lumpy and spongy skin hides toxin glands which release a quickly evaporating colour- and odorless toxin that, upon skin contact or inhalation, leads to harrowing pain, long lasting paralysis and even death. Due to this feature, Gobblers have almost no natural predators, causing them to generally act carefree, curious and playful. This  makes them even more dangerous, as Gobblers fearlessly seek out the company of other beings to play with them - oftentimes accidently killing them in the process.  Some assume the toxicity to be a result of the Gobbler's diet, raising the question on what on earth Gobblers are eating.
051_toxic_gobbler.name: Toxic Gobbler

052_wendigo_1.description: Wendigos plague humanoid civilization since the dawn of time. Nothing embodies the cruelty and danger of untamed wilderness as well as the Wendigo. They are the terror of the wilderness incarnate, primal fear given a gangly shape and raking claws. Their true origin remains unknown, but some cultures perceive them to be spirits of hunger and greed, possessing avaricious individuals and turning them into the ferocious predators that stalk dark woods and bleak frontiers, hunting and devouring their former kin. Wendigos are swift and silent hunters, terrifying stalkers and savage butchers, capable of outmaneuvering and outsmarting even well-armed and steadfast groups of adventurers before unleashing upon them a terrifying display of primal carnage, leaving red snow in their wake, as they adorn their hunting grounds with grisly trophies.
052_wendigo_1.name: Wendigo

052_wendigo_2.description: Wendigos plague humanoid civilization since the dawn of time. Nothing embodies the cruelty and danger of untamed wilderness as well as the Wendigo. 052_wendigo_2.name: Wendigo

052_wendigo_4.name: Wendigo

053_magmatic_coreborn.description: Coreborn rise from fissures or smoldering calderas as a result of increased volcanic activity. Combining aspects of both fire and earth elementals, they differ from their kin due to their amiable disposition towards humanoids. A Magmatic Coreborn may choose to protect a village built on the slope of a volcano or at the heart of a high island, using its dominance over earth and fire to ward off both natural and unnatural disaster from their chosen people. Many Coreborn are worshipped as minor deities by their tribes, growing in power through veneration.
053_magmatic_coreborn.name: Magmatic Coreborn

054_bog_strider.description: Bog Striders are large predatory insects towering on spindly legs, commonly found in swamps, marshes or the eponymous bogs. Bog Striders are attracted to their prey by ripples in the murky water, using their front legs as sensors for the vibrations. The Bog Strider aims to puncture its prey's body with its proboscis and injects acidic saliva that liquifies the innards, sucking out the resulting fluid. Due to their low intelligence and high dependency on pheromonal markings, they can be controlled with special pheromonal cocktails, making them ideal mounts for traversing wetlands.
054_bog_strider.name: Bog Strider

055_klabautermann.description: Klabautermänner are manifestations of a ships spirit, a result of a deep bond between a storied vessel and its crew. Mostly acting as an unseen force of good, when taking physical Klabautermänner love to manifest as a skeletal mariner, guiding their threatened vessel through a storm, repelling a boarding party or assisting in navigating treacherous waters. As a crew's bond and reputation grows, so does the Klabautermann's power - the mightiest of them being able to assert their control over weather and sea to prevent imminent disaster.
055_klabautermann.name: Klabautermann

056_sword_guardian.description: Not long after the invention of the trusty Shield Guardian demand  for a more attack-oriented counterpart spiked. This lead to the development of the Sword Guardian, a more nimble, albeit less hardy construct that excels at close quarter combat. Their combat tactics can be switched at a moment's notice, making them both capable bodyguards and assertive enforcers. While their stiff movements appear predictable, incautious opponents often find themselves blocked in by an unending barrage of precise Greatsword blows. Like their defensive brother-constructs, they are valuable assets for wizards in need of some artifical muscle or wealthy merchants looking for an effective deterrent.
056_sword_guardian.name: Sword Guardian

057_ridgeback_dunecrawler.description: Due to the spinal ougrowths on their upper shell, Ridgebacks can easily be mistaken for a cragged rock formation, especially when partially buried beneath the arid soil of their preferred habitat. They continually filter swathes of sand through gill-like structures, indiscriminately feeding on organic and non-organic matter, be it mineral deposits, plants, living creatures or dried out carcasses. A wandering or resting Ridgeback does not pose any particular danger, nomadic tribes are known to hitch a ride on a Dunecrawler's back to traverse the desert without the great beast paying them any mind. But their temper matches their size, and an angered Ridgeback resembles a force of nature, a walking mountain with titanic strength, shrouded in an ever-swirling tempest of sand.
057_ridgeback_dunecrawler.name: Ridgeback Dunecrawler

058_vrubel.description: Braying flocks of Vrubel cloud the multicoloured skies of the Abyss, their harrowing shrieks unnaturally reveberating through the twisted landscapes of madness. A gathering of Vrubel forms a choir, each of their voices intertwining into the abyssal dirge, a maddening song capable of twisting and breaking the minds of even the most stalwart individuals. The abyssal choirs act as demonic envoys, transmitting messages for higher demons to other planes of existence, carrying with them the innate chaos of the Abyss.
058_vrubel.name: Vrubel

059_gladiator_retiarius.description: Gladiators are grouped into different types, varying heavily in both fighting style and equipment. Certain types of Gladiator exclusively fight their respective counterpart, each fight resembling a deadly choreography studied to perfection. Retiarius and Murmillo exclusively duel each other, both of their skills honed to overcome the other. The Retiarius is a flink-footed and more lightly armoured fighter who nimbly evades their more heavily armoured opponent, only to artfully entangle them with their net and set up the perfect thrust from their trident.
059_gladiator_retiarius.name: Gladiator Retiarius

059_gladiator_murmillo.description: The brutish Murmillo however is recruited from the ranks of the most steadfast fighters, almost impossible to topple and capable of withstanding tremendous punishment. Both are evenly matched and capable of holding the audience's attention with their taunts and flourishes, their signature maneuvers and lethal finishers.
059_gladiator_murmillo.name: Gladiator Murmillo

059_gladiator_dimachaerus.description: The Dimachaerus is the diva of the arena, a master duelist who captivates the audience with artistic bladework and dizzying acrobatics. Fluidly switching between offensive and defensive fighting styles, the Dimachaerus prides themself on their ability to face any opponent, capable of outmaneuvering both the nimble Retiarius and outfighting the towering Murmillo. But a Dimachaerus balances on a knife's edge, any misstep in their complex choreography will be punished by their opponents - and the fickle audience, its favour as easily withdrawn as it is granted.
059_gladiator_dimachaerus.name: Gladiator Dimachaerus

060_crazed_reaper.description: Incessant screaming heralds the approach of the Crazed Reaper, a towering monstrosity filled with apoplectic madness and massive scythes for hands. It is to be assumed that these creatures did not came to be in a way even remotely considered natural and any means of reproduction short of mitosis by sheer force of anger seems unlikely. But until the source of their all-consuming madness is discovered, solitary Reapers will roam the lands, driven to murder anything that stands in their path, leaving a trail of severed limbs and burst ear drums in their wake, as well as more questions that could possibly be answered.
060_crazed_reaper.name: Crazed Reaper

061_clangorsaurus.description: Clangosaurs roam lost and forgotten parts of the world where unique circumstances allow for flora and fauna from primeval times to endure. Both male and female members of the species engange in territorial disputes by smashing their bone-plated heads against each other, a ritual that produces a sound that can be heard for miles. Clangorsaurs are highly aggressive, actively seeking confrontation with anything treading on their stomping grounds, crashing into their targets without any shreds of self preservation.
061_clangorsaurus.name: Clangorsaurus

062_pit_abomination.description: Abominations are born from accursed breeding pits using forbidden biomancy, heretical alchemical formulae and mutagens harvested from countless monstrosities. Each Abomination comes out differently, as the primordial soup filling the pits is ever shifting in its makeup and consistency, but they all have an inherited hate for this cruel world that birthed them. Impervious to pain and unable to form complex thoughts, it is a living weapon capable of unfathomable destruction. A weapon wielded by Pit Broodmasters, a caste dedicated to training and bonding with the towering abominations, feeding their hate and driving them into combat, annihilating everything in their path.
062_pit_abomination.name: Pit Abomination

062_pit_broodmaster.description: They themselves tainted by the vile alchemy and mutagens of the Breeding Pits, Broodmasters tear the pit spawn from their birthing sacs and beat their will into the mewling creature. What follows is an inhuman regiment of subjugation and conditioning, to form the pit spawn into an unfeeling instrument of war. The most vile creature birthed from the pits is the Abomination, a chimeric monstrosity combining traits from countless creatures into a looming behemoth capable of unfathomable destruction. These war-beasts are herded into slaughter by the Broodmasters, controlled by secret drugs and techniques only known to initiatives to their corrupted caste.
062_pit_broodmaster.name: Pit Broodmaster

063_beckoning_devil.description: Beckoning Devil's are favoured courtiers of the Father of Lies, one of the ruling Devils of the Nine Hells. With their seductive and corrupting powers, they seek to gain control over groups of powerful individuals to drive them into ruin, only to finally offer them salvation in their Lord's service. They possess a malign intelligence and relish their dark purpose, drawing great pleasure from the hunt. Once fixated on future servants worthy of their Lord, Beckoning Devils are relentless stalkers, quickly forcing their prey to question their sanity, as their paranoia swells and memories become unreliable. Those dominated by the Devil they are finally forced to commit harrowing atrocities, until they are left with no choice but to bow their knee to the dark patron of Lies.
063_beckoning_devil.name: Beckoning Devil

064_grey_pilgrim.description: The unusual beings dubbed Grey Pilgrims wander the realms in search for enlightenment, be it in solitude, be it accompanied by disciples or mentors of their own choosing. Each of them has been given form by divine hands, created to study as much as to teach. They continuously reflect on the principles of divinity, the cosmos and the nature of mortality, each Pilgrim eventually reaching their own conclusion, before imparting their knowledge unto worthy souls and returning to the side of their creator. While on their journey, they go out of their way to inspire the ambition and resolve of those burdened by strife and suffering..
064_grey_pilgrim.name: Grey Pilgrim

065_sovereigns_guard.description: Kings and Queens, Hierophants and Arch-Bishops, Emperors and Empresses - these sovereigns dare not resting their wellbeing on the meek shoulders of regular guards or hired mercenaries. A true sovereign requires an elite guard, drilled fighters of supreme ability and mental strength, eager to continously prove their worth and unwavering loyalty. The Sovereign's Guard represent an elite cadre of bodyguards and combat specialists, well versed in both protecting their liege or carrying out special tasks all over the realm.
065_sovereigns_guard.name: Sovereign's Guard

066_scorched_legionary.description: The Scorched Legion's origins lie within the ash-choked plains of the Realm of Fire. The lords of the realm are in constant warfare, their mortal troops long expended. Unyielding, relentless soldiers were formed from volcanic rock and embers of the Primordial Flame. Soon the Scorched Legionaries waged eternal war on their masters behalf, their conflicts soon encroaching onto the mortal realms. They are devastating heavy infantry, blindly following their master's commands, untiring and without mercy. Many a desperate sovereign turns to the lords of the Fire Realm as a means to aquire the might of the Legion for their own purpose, not knowing, that by doing so they may doom the very realm they try to protect or conquer.
066_scorched_legionary.name: Scorched Legionary

067_rustmire_gadfly.description: Rustmire Gadflies infest the auburn marshlands of the Rustmire, their incessant droning turning this already wicked place into even more of a hostile hellscape. By the dozens a swarm of Gadflies descents on a suitable victim - be it man or beast - and feed on them, leaving it bite-marked but alive, as they do not kill their victims (intentionally, at least), but prefer to feed on it over the span of days or weeks instead. They are, however, carriers of the unsavoury and often lethal Bloodscorch plague and can often be found feeding on the pustulent remains of their infected victim.
067_rustmire_gadfly.name: Rustmire Gadfly

068_wereboar.description: Skinchangers come in any shape or size and even the cause of their transformation differs - be it affliction of body or mind, a curse, possession or even a blessing. The transformation into a Wereboar, however, seldom is anything but a curse, one reserved mostly for gluttonous and vulgar individuals, whose porcine characteristics where apparent even before their body took a shape their mind had already taken. Wereboars are boorish and brutish, bulky and barrelchested slabs of pure muscle, held together by a thick hide. But their cunning is not to be unterestimated and many would-be slayers fell to the goring tusks of a Wereboar after failing to discern the sparks of malign intellect within their deep-set eyes.
068_wereboar.name: Wereboar

068_wereboar_2.description: Skinchangers come in any shape or size and even the cause of their transformation differs - be it affliction of body or mind, a curse, possession or even a blessing. The transformation into a Wereboar, however, seldom is anything but a curse, one reserved mostly for gluttonous and vulgar individuals, whose porcine characteristics where apparent even before their body took a shape their mind had already taken. Wereboars are boorish and brutish, bulky and barrelchested slabs of pure muscle, held together by a thick hide. But their cunning is not to be unterestimated and many would-be slayers fell to the goring tusks of a Wereboar after failing to discern the sparks of malign intellect within their deep-set eyes.
068_wereboar_2.name: Wereboar

069_dollmaker_devil.description: Like all of their infernal kindred, Dollmaker Devils relish in the seduction and eventual corruption of mortal souls. They take s rather direct approach, using their cursed touch to turn their victims into paralyzed dolls and binding them via infernal threads, entangling a creature's very soul. This allows the Devil to take on the role of a perverse puppeteer, controlling a creatures immediate actions by tugging the right strings or even ending their life with a swift severing of the threads. Dollmakers are craven creatures, relying on networks of worshippers or debtors to protect it, while it stalks nightly streets for fresh dolls.
069_dollmaker_devil.name: Dollmaker Devil

070_airship_sentry_automaton.description: Automated sentries were first utilized during a great exhibition showcasing different proofs of concept concerning the development of techno-arcane automata. These prototypes were expanded upon by military scientists and now serve as sentries and boarding repellents on various airships throughout the realms. Their armaments consist of heavy boarding axes, short-ranged ocular beams and advanced kinetic shielding, all powered by a miniature techno-arcane reactor. These sentries are able to activate a magnetic field, allowing them to safely battle any threats while being mag-locked to an airship's metal hull. Gunner variants are also known to operate the heavy Thunderstrike Pattern Airship Cannons utilized by great military airships, such as the Dawn Emperor and Storm Herald class.
070_airship_sentry_automaton.name: Airship Sentry Automaton

071_blade_slave.description: Blade Slaves are living weapons created by the dozens and hundreds, prisoners, heretics and other undesirables with their body and mind broken by confinement and torture. They now only crave the kiss of the blade, living vicariously through both the pain they suffer and the pain they inflict upon others. They are utilized by Ecclesiarchs and Inquisitors, driven before them as a showing of ruthlessness and intimidaton or unleashed from their mobile confines as shock troops, overwhelming their master's enemies as a cackling and foaming wave of bodies and blades.
071_blade_slave.name: Blade Slave

072_slipstream_phaseknife.description: Equipped with experimental techno-arcane Slipstream Generators, Phaseknives are an elite cadre of operatives specialised in high-risk assassinations that require pinpoint accuracy and leave no room for errors. Seamlessly phasing in and out of a subspace corridor dubbed the Slipstream, they effortlessly outmaneuver and overwhelm conventional defenses and deliver a perfect killing strike. Traditionally, Phaseknives work in pairs to ensure the mission's success, coordinating their unpredictable attacks at a breackneck pace, relying on speed and accuracy honed to perfection to carry out their missions.
072_slipstream_phaseknife.name: Slipstream Phaseknife

073_gorgeleaper.description: Gorgeleapers are arboreal hunters, leaping through mazelike treetops of the sky-scraping southern rainforests. They are expert climbers and navigate the treacherous terrain of their homes with terrifying ease, effortlessly stalking their prey before ambushing it. Gorgeleapers do not kill their prey immediately but swallow it instead, carrying the creature in their gullet to hidden birthing pools in the rainfilled calyxes of the aptly named Nursery Chalice, a carnivorous pitcher plant existing in symbiosis with the Gorgeleapers.
073_gorgeleaper.name: Gorgeleaper

073_gorgeleaper_01.description: Gorgeleapers are arboreal hunters, leaping through mazelike treetops of the sky-scraping southern rainforests. They are expert climbers and navigate the treacherous terrain of their homes with terrifying ease, effortlessly stalking their prey before ambushing it. 073_gorgeleaper_01.name: Gorgeleaper

073_gorgeleaper_03.name: Gorgeleaper

073_gorgeleaper_02.name: Gorgeleaper

074_undead_pikeman.description: Hushed voices tell of the Burial Host, an endless column of shambling undead pressed into service by a council of necromancers, fleshgrafters and carnal artisans. Heralded by the buzzing of bloated flies, the Burial Host descends upon cities or countryside alike, overwhelming even the sturdiest defenses in an unending onslaught of rotten flesh and rusted blades. Gaps within the ranks of the host are quickly filled, as the war machinery grinds forward, a self-serving and self-sustaining perpetuum mobile of death and rebirth. Undead Pikemen form the front rows of the Host, forcing their enemies into exasperating wars of attrition
074_undead_pikeman.name: Undead Pikeman

075_guild_artillerist.description: Due to government contracts, the (traditionally dwarven) members of the great Powder Guilds, those organisations authorized to research and develop mechanical firearms, are also utilized as a well-trained militia, often requiring mandatory service escorting the great Trade Fleets trawling the great Archipelago. This leaves many guild members with first-hand combat experience and some will stay within the military branch of the guilds, choosing the life of an Artillerist over that of an Artisan. They serve with a deep understanding of their craft, burning to further hone their skills as combat engineers, artillery and demolition specialists or expert marksmen.
075_guild_artillerist.name: Guild Artillerist

076_deathsworn.description: Seeing a Deathsworn fight is witnessing a ceremonial choreography, as they seamlessly weave their opponents into an intimate dance of death. Deathsworn exhibit great respect towards their enemies, going so far as to carry the ritually cleaned and hallowed skulls of particularly worthy opponents alongside of those of their closest kin - signifying their bond forged in battle, either on equal or opposing sides. The certainty of their own death is meaningless to a Deathsworn, as they resign to it each time they take up their spear and shroud their face with the Sho’ufa, expressing their resolve to kill and die honorably in the eyes of their ancestors.
076_deathsworn.name: Deathsworn

077_necromancer.description: Necromancers are magic users who pursued the arcane arts beyond the restrictions that nature and mortality place upon less curious souls. Death is a strong metaphysical concept and those tapping into the domain of biological and metaphysical death quickly find themselves swelling with power, as they carry life into the realms of death to reanimate bodies or manipulate souls, or invite death into the realms of the living, turning flesh to dust and withering body and soul. This power quickly corrupts and many societies fear, shun or hunt those who passed the treshold and invited death into their life.
077_necromancer.name: Necromancer

078_necrovolt_circuitslave.description: Circuitslaves are burned-out husks powered by the abyssal energies of the Netherstorm. Through the shapeless Necrovolt, a being of sentient lightning accidentally created and worshipped by the Reanimator Conclaves, they are connected to their masters in a cursed circuit, living lightning coursing continously coursing through them. They eternally hunger for more energy, seeking out living creatures to drain their bodies of it.
078_necrovolt_circuitslave.name: Necrovolt Circuitslave

078_necrovolt_reanimator.description: The Necrovolt Reanimators are a conclave of deranged scientists who discovered the abyssal Netherstorm, a sentient tempest of howling souls, charged with cracking aether-lightning. Reanimators harness the Netherstorm’s boundless energy with their Necrovoltaic Generators, using it to power various nightmarish machineries and undead constructs. Over time fanatical members of the Reanimator Conclave seemingly discerned sentience within their own devices, remnants of the soul-lightning powering them. This ghost in the machine was dubbed the Necrovolt, a being of unliving lightning made manifest.
078_necrovolt_reanimator.name: Necrovolt Reanimator

079_mummy.description: Ages ago Ankh was ruled by ancient god-beasts, forcing their subjects to conquer a vast empire in their name. The surrounding realms where powerless against the god-beasts otherworldly might and divine wrath and soon an empire was carved from bone, blood and sand with mighty monuments of worship rising from the desert ground wherever the slave-armies of Ankh marched. The god-beasts were cast down using the cthonian Duat Blades, their wielders were lauded as heroes and ruled Ankh for ages, their lifespan unnaturally extended by the cursed blades. As they eventually died, they would rise again and reclaim their blades, their embalmed and mummified bodies serving as hollow vessels for the energies of the Duat. Legions of shambling mummies follow in their wake, once more called to war by their queens and princes, now waging war on their own erstwhile kin-blood.
079_mummy.name: Mummy

080_sharakhul.description: Ages ago, the great dragon Sharakhul fell victim to a hive of Mind Tyrants, a psionically gifted race of subterran conquerers and slavers. Seeking a new vessel for their abominable hive mind, they spend decades torturing the dragon into submission, bent on erasing his spirit, originally intent on leaving the body intact. But the great dragon resisted and as punishment they psychically flayed him, stripping away his indomitable scales and reducing his form to a mass of undulating flesh.His body flayed and defiled, his mind fractured in unmendable ways, the broken husk of Sharakhul rose from the depths and sought exile, pouring himself into foul methods of blood magic in a desperate attempt to mend his flesh and restore his scales
080_sharakhul.name: Sharakhul

081_crusader.description: Crusaders are chosen warriors infused with holy purpose, traveling the lands to retrieve lost relics, protect priests and pilgrims or enact divine judgement against sworn enemies of their patron saint or deity. They are singular in devotion, trained in the arts of war from a young age and eager to prove their worthiness at any cost.
081_crusader.name: Crusader

082_shell_sage.description: Shell-Sages wander the lands oblivious to possible danger, protected only by their trusty shell, sheer legendary luck and the hesitation of possible predators, as their would-be prey moves through their territory with confusing self-assuredness and tranquility. Shell-Sages owe their title to the habit of withdrawing into the safety of their eponymous shell, spending days and even weeks in deep contemplation, from which they they only awake due to the excitement experienced by stumbling upon especially profound insights. Wild animals or curious people are drawn to the shell, listening to the calming, mumbled utterances echoing from within the shell.
082_shell_sage.name: Shell Sage

083_hydra.description: The Hydra is an ancient nightmare given form, coiling serpent heads, their curved fangs dripping with lethal poison and a towering reptile body capable of moving with unsettling grace - there is nothing about the Hydra that does not evoke vivid imagery and primal fears whenever its name is whispered. Hydrae are dangerous to hunt, as even a mortally wounded beast might return after only days have passed and whole swathes of land have been put to the torch to drive such a monstrosity from its lair and finally put an end to it.
083_hydra.name: Hydra

084_mimic.description: It is unclear how exactly Mimics came to be. The leading theory proposes that a Wizard sought a way to secure his riches and enchanted a chest to simply make it come alive and eat intruders, which, knowing wizards, does not seem too far-fetched. How we ended up with the voracious ambush predators taking all manner of shapes or for ms still poses some unanswered questions. Similarly, unclear is how Mimics reproduce, even if the thought of pocket-sized chests with big eyes is delightful. Some theorize that Mimic eggs eerily resemble gold coins, allowing Mimics to mix their brood into the treasures they guard.
084_mimic.name: Mimic

085_aberrant_tyrant.description: Aberrant Tyrants birth themselves into the Material Plane through their dreams and nightmares. Considering themselves the apex of creation, an Aberrant Tyrant’s worst nightmare is to be trapped in a world filled with inferior creatures. Due to the nature of the dreamlands beyond the veil, these nightmares are manifested, and the Tyrant is brought forth into the mundane world, where it promptly goes mad from the combined horrors of this experience and the utter contempt towards the vile inhabitants of this hellscape. Some Tyrants however dream of subjugating foreign worlds their inhabitants, only to wake up finally being able to do so. They are, however, no less insane.
085_aberrant_tyrant.name: Aberrant Tyrant

000_goblin_pack_1_crookshank_1.description: Crookshanks mark the rank and file of a Raid Rabble, both conscripted and willing participants of mixed age and skill. Most goblins are used to fight creatures larger than them and they make the most of it, trying to swarm enemies to bring them down, where their eponymous crooked blades are waiting. Goblins aren’t eager to die fighting, as each dead goblin weakens the tribe. This utilitarian view on survival has earned them a reputation of cowardice, but if Goblins commit to a fight, they do so without hesitation, fully aware of their mortality and knowing that their death will only empower the raid, as their Shaman draws great strength from them.
000_goblin_pack_1_crookshank_1.name: Goblin Crookshank

000_goblin_pack_1_shrublurker_1.description: Shrublurkers spend most of their life outside the confines of a goblin village and are both feared and respected for it. Children like to test boundaries and explore their surroundings, goblin childred are no different. If they venture to far from the village, chances of survival are slim. But those who return exhibit a knack for survival and necessary amount of luck that qualifies them for adoption by a senior Shrublurker, the old veteran hoping to impart as much knowledge as possible on their successor before their inevitable death. Shrublurkers are expert trackers and trappers and are forced to quickly adapt to the flora and fauna surrounding their village or die an early death. During a raid, Shrublurkers act as scouts, sharpshooters and saboteurs, exposing key weaknesses or marking priority targets.
000_goblin_pack_1_shrublurker_1.name: Goblin Shrublurker

000_goblin_pack_1_rabble_rouser_1.description: Within the confines of a goblin village everyone has to pull their weight. There is no place for ego, grudges or feuds, as time is better spent improving the ever slim chances of the tribe’s survival than to indulge in petty conflicts. Some goblins chafe under this, for reasons of temper, personality or sheer stubborn obstinacy. A Raid Rabble is a great way to send these Rabble-Rousers to blow off some steam, before they start developing some dangerous thoughts. This is a win-win situation, as they make for furious warriors, passionate looters and grandstanding braggarts, taking their attention away from getting into trouble, continuously telling of their heroic deeds instead. That is, if they return.
000_goblin_pack_1_rabble_rouser_1.name: Goblin Rabble Rouser

There is no place for ego, grudges or feuds, as time is better spent improving the ever slim chances of the tribe’s survival than to indulge in petty conflicts. Some goblins chafe under this, for reasons of temper, personality or sheer stubborn obstinacy. A Raid Rabble is a great way to send these Rabble-Rousers to blow off some steam, before they start developing some dangerous thoughts. This is a win-win situation, as they make for furious warriors, passionate looters and grandstanding braggarts, taking their attention away from getting into trouble, continuously telling of their heroic deeds instead. That is, if they return.
000_goblin_pack_1_rabble_rouser_2.name: Goblin Rabble Rouser

000_goblin_pack_1_hog_rider_1.description: Hog Riders are brawny and boorish, characteristics they share with their black-bristled mounts. They are veterans of several raids, having earned their place upon the back of a towering boar. They are fast in and fast out, barreling forth from the underbrush and into the thick of combat before turning on their heel, grabbing what they can and retreating once the rest of the Rabble swarms in. Once the baggage is secured, the rest of the Raid Rabble retreats back into cover, with arrows and grenades raining unto eventual pursuers from hidden Shrublurkers.
000_goblin_pack_1_hog_rider_1.name: Goblin Hog Rider

000_goblin_pack_1_hog_rider_2.description: Hog Riders are brawny and boorish, characteristics they share with their black-bristled mounts. 000_goblin_pack_1_hog_rider_2.name: Goblin Hog Rider

000_goblin_pack_1_soulshaper_shaman.description: Soulshaper Shamans oversee a tribe’s death rites and stand vigil during the transition of a goblin’s soul beyond the mortal veil. They do this to take note of where this particular soul goes, to eventually drag it back to fulfill various purposes, should the need arise. Necessity is the mother of invention, goblins die in droves - why not capitalise on that? The goblins are thankful for their ancestor’s service and both live and die knowing that their duty does not end in death. A Shaman’s word carries a lot of weight, as they are known to converse with the spirits of the afterlife and carry the knowledge of the ancestors. Most shamans however quickly find out that dying does not automatically impart knowledge and most ancestors are as dense in death as they were in life. This realisation usually sours a Soulshaper Shaman’s mood and factors into their characteristic bitterness.
000_goblin_pack_1_soulshaper_shaman.name: Goblin Soulshaper Shaman

000_goblin_pack_1_soulstarved_abominatio.description: The shambling and frankly horrifying Soulstarved Abominations are Soulshaper Shaman’s failed attempt to just kind of stuff a goblin’s soul back into a vessel, be it their former body or an vaguely goblin-shaped flesh-construct. Still, something must have worked out as planned, as these aptly named Abominations walk and fight, despite their unsettling appearence and even more unsettling hunger for flesh. If a Soulshaper Shaman is part of a Raid Rabble, the Abominations can be found shuffling in its wake, herded by their creator into combat as unliving weapons.
000_goblin_pack_1_soulstarved_abominatio.name: Goblin Soulstarved Abomination
