086_fire_manifestation.description: Fire Manifestations a living blazes inhabiting the ever-burning plane of Eternal Fire. Into this ash-choked realm of red sand and molten rock retreated the primordial beings of flame once the immense magic potential necessary to feed them slowly bled from the young world's bones into the beings of flesh and blood that slowly came to inhabit and shape it. The Manifestations are personified elemental forces, fire's unsatiable hunger and destructive nature given flickering form. In the profane world, Manifestations flock to places connected to their native plane or appear in the wake of fire-related disasters powerful enough to tear through the veil between planes.
086_fire_manifestation.name: Fire Manifestation

087_wintergrim.description: Sudden drops in temperature and billowing snowstorms herald the coming of a Wintergrim. Wintergrim are murderous fey creatures and intrude into the profane world during a time where the temperature drops to unnatural lows and the snow mantle becomes a burial shroud for humans and livestock alike. Hunters don’t return from the forest, rime coats windows and even a fire’s heat may no longer banish the exisential cold that has seeped into body and spirit. Until banished by the return of spring, the Wintergrim will hunt, its pale bestial hands choking life and and warmth from its victims, leaving behind only icy skin and blood on the snow. At the seasonal height of its power, even powerful iron wards may not keep a Wintergrim at bay and many a frontier village turns to ancient pacts sealed with blood and sacrifice instead.
087_wintergrim.name: Wintergrim

088_magarach_sentinel.description: Magarach were created as an ancient warrior caste to serve the formless Waking One as temple guardians, but were abandoned by their creator. With the Magarach still tending to overgrown vestiges of past glory, nature has reclaimed the once thriving temple complexes and the Magarach, blessed with the right to bathe within the sacred waters they guard, are granted longevity bordering on immortality. The Magarach protect these hidden wells, as within the sacred waters the essence of the Waking One still lingers on. Upon death, a Magarach's soul returns to these wells and it will soon rise once more, accumulating hundreds of lifetimes worth of experience, knowledge and grudges over the centuries..
088_magarach_sentinel.name: Magarach Sentinel

089_berserker.description: Berserkers are chosen warriors who rejected a normal life and embraced the savage nature of the Bear. Giving in to the totemic spirit they were transformed, taking on the form of the great Beast from which they draw their otherworldly strenghs. Either as nomadic sages or part of a group of warriors they seek glory and adventure, tightly wrapped by the strings of fate - a Berserker is sure to either become a scourge upon the land or a fabled folk hero, there is no room for mediocrity.
089_berserker.name: Berserker

090_swordbearer_reliquary.description: Swordbearer Reliquaries are vestiges of past ages, walking shrines dedicated to a forgotten deity of war and valor. These silent effigies are named Swordbearers, for ancient blades are driven deeply into their craggy form, unclear to which purpose - remembrance or veneration? It is also unknown what causes life to spark within the overgrown form of the Reliquary, causing it to rise and wander. Maybe the souls of the ancient blades thirst for battle once more, or maybe the lost deity itself slowly wakes from its god-slumber, sending out these living shrines as solemn emissaries to seek out worthy warriors to receive the old god’s favor.
090_swordbearer_reliquary.name: Swordbearer Reliquary

091_guild_heretic.description: Former artisans of the great Powder, Steam and Clockwork guilds disgraced for their continued interest in banned technologies gathered around Rekwyn Gharst, the master artisan often referred to as a heretic. Shunned and in hiding due to their perverse pursuit of Viscerart, a self-coined portmanteau elevating intricate bloodshed and indiscriminate bombings to a controversial artform, the Heretics are a collective of like-minded individuals, continually developing new mechanical abominations, which exist in mockery of the fragility of the humanoid form. Guild Heretics take great pride in their devastating arsenal and each drop of spilled blood is a badge of honour..
091_guild_heretic.name: Guild Heretic

092_gargling_headtaker_1.description: Gargling Headtakers roam shallow waters and coastal regions, inhabiting flooded coves or stranded shipwrecks. They are an unsettling sight, lumbering mancrabs, foam dripping ceaselessly from their strange crustacean mouthparts, unfeeling eyes and wiggling antennas. As they hunt in small packs, their characteristic and disquieting gargling noises used to communicate oftentimes herald an incoming attack. When fighting, the Headtakers make use of their oversized pincers, grasping, impaling or crushing their prey, knowing no difference between man or animal.
092_gargling_headtaker_1.name: Gargling Headtaker 1

092_gargling_headtaker_3.name: Gargling Headtaker 3

093_faceless.description: Faceless are demons of murder, summoned by ritual and bound to a worldy anchor by its summoner. Faceless tirelessly hunt their prey, unhindered by locks, guards or castle walls. Despite acting independently, each Faceless is an aspect of a greater demonic entity, either unable or unwilling to leave its home plane. This makes Faceless all the more terrifying, as a designated victim oftentimes finds itself harried by a neverending stream of demonic incursions until it finally succumbs to the continuous assaults. A creature targeted by the Faceless can only hope for the summoner's death or to evade its own demise long enough to wear out the patience of the demon.
093_faceless.name: Faceless

094_skeletal_sapper.description: Skeletal Sappers were devised by the Bonemason Pioneers of the Burial Host. Sappers are driven towards fortified settlements to tear holes into their defenses, allowing the rest to advance through the ruined fortifications. These tactics were quickly adopted by ambitious necromancers and ossian artisans throughout the realms.
094_skeletal_sapper.name: Skeletal Sapper
